Question: Service type
Hint: Select one option relevant to your service. For more detail on each category, please take a look at the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) definitions of cloud computing services.

Question: Choose the categories that apply to your service
Hint: You can choose multiple categories.

Question: Service name
Hint: Include your product name only. Using additional keywords may impact your acceptance on to the Digital Marketplace.

Question: Service summary
Hint: Please provide a short description of your service. (Maximum 50 words.) You'll be asked to go into more detail about the features and benefits of your service on the next page. Company information should not be included here. You can provide a company description for your supplier page elsewhere.

Question: Service features
Hint: Include the technical features of your product, eg graphical workflow, remote access. (Maximum 10 words per feature. Maximum 10 features.)

Question: Service benefits
Hint: Include benefits that show how your service helps users improve their business. Use active phrases, eg publish content from multiple devices, quickly manage content on the move.  (Maximum 10 words per benefit. Maximum 10 benefits.)

Question: Service definition document
Hint: Please upload your service definition. Refer to the ITT documentation for further guidance on what to include. This document will not be indexed by search on the Digital Marketplace. Use an open document format, eg odf, pdf or pda. (Maximum file size 5MB.)

Question: Please upload your terms and conditions document
Hint: Please upload your terms and conditions document. This document will not be indexed by search on the Digital Marketplace. Use an open document format, eg odf, pdf or pda. (Maximum file size 5MB.)

Question: Service price
Hint: This is an indicative price. Users will be able to refer to your pricing document for more information.

Question: Education pricing
Hint: Do you offer special pricing for educational organisations?

Question: Pricing document
Hint: Please upload your pricing document. This document will not be indexed by search on the Digital Marketplace. Use an open document format, eg odf, pdf or pda. (Maximum file size 5MB.)

Question: Skills Framework for the Information Age (SFIA) rate card
Hint: Please upload your SFIA rate card if you have one. This document will not be indexed by search on the Digital Marketplace. Use an open document format, eg odf, pdf or pda. (Maximum file size 5MB.)

Question: Open standards supported and documented
Hint: Take a look at the GOV.UK Open Standards principles for more information on open standards.

Question: Support service type
Hint: Choose all that apply.

Question: Support accessible to any third-party suppliers
Support availablility
Hint: eg 24/7 or 9 to 5. (Maximum 20 words.)

Question: Standard support response times
Hint: How long will it take until support can begin to be provided? eg 1 hour or 1 business day. (Maximum 20 words.)

Question: Service provisioning time
Hint: How long does it take to get your service up and running? For example 1 to 5 hours, 2 to 3 days.

Question: API type
Hint: Examples of API include RESTful and SOAP.

Question: Networks the service is directly connected to
Hint: Choose all that apply.

Question: Supported web browsers
Hint: Choose all that apply.

Question: Supported devices
Hint: Choose all that apply.

Question: Vendor certification(s)
Hint: Examples of certifications include VMware Certified Professional and Oracle Gold Partner. (Optional.)

Question: Datacentres adhere to EU Code of Conduct for Operations
Datacentre tier
Hint: Choose one

Question: Backup, disaster recovery and resilience plan in place
Hint: You can provide more detail on your disaster recovery plan in your service definition document.

Question: Data protection between user device and service
Hint: Choose 1

Question: Data protection within service
Hint: Choose 1

Question: Data protection between services
Hint: Choose 1

Question: Datacentre location
Hint: Where are the service provider's datacentres located? Choose all that apply.
Answer 4: Other countries with data protection treaties

Question: Data management location
Hint: Where are the services managed from? Choose all that apply.
Answer 4: Other countries with data protection treaties

Question: Legal jurisdiction of service provider
Hint: Choose 1
Answer 4: Other countries with data protection treaties

Question: Datacentre protection
Hint: Do the datacentres where your consumer data is located have suitable physical security?

Question: Data-at-rest protection
Hint: How is storage containing consumer data-at-rest protected from unauthorised access? Choose 1.

Question: Secure data deletion
Hint: How do you erase consumer data when resources are moved or re-provisioned, or when the consumer leaves the service, or when they request it to be erased? Choose 1.

Question: Storage media disposal
Hint: How is storage media containing consumer data sanitised or securely destroyed at the end of its usable lifetime? Choose 1.

Question: Secure equipment disposal
Hint: Is all equipment potentially containing consumer data, credentials or configuration information identified at the end of its life or prior to being recycled? Choose 1.

Question: Secure component disposal
Hint: How are any components containing sensitive data sanitised, removed or destroyed? Choose 1.

Question: Redundant equipment accounts revoked
Hint: Are accounts or credentials specific to redundant equipment revoked to reduce their value to an attacker?

Question: Service availability (%)
Hint: What is the availability of the service? eg 99.99%

Question: Cloud deployment model
Hint: Is the service a public, private, community or hybrid cloud service?

Question: Type of consumer
Hint: What types of other consumer do your consumers share the service or platform with?

Question: Services separation
Hint: Do you provide separation of consumer data and service from other consumers of the service?

Question: Services management separation
Hint: Is the management of a consumer’s service kept separate from other consumers?

Question: Governance framework
Hint: Do you have a governance framework and process in place for the service, eg ISO277001:2013?

Question: Configuration and change management tracking
Hint: Are the status, location and configuration of service components tracked throughout their lifetime?

Question: Change impact assessment
Hint: Are changes to the service assessed for potential security impact? And are changes managed and tracked through to completion?

Question: Vulnerability assessment
Hint: Are potential new threats, vulnerabilities or exploitation techniques which could affect the service assessed, and are corrective actions taken?

Question: Vulnerability monitoring
Hint: Do you monitor relevant sources of information relating to threat, vulnerability and exploitation techniques?

Question: Vulnerability mitigation prioritisation
Hint: Are the severity of threats and vulnerabilities considered within the context of the service and do you use this information to prioritise implementation of mitigations?

Question: Complete vulnerability change-management process
Hint: Are known vulnerabilities within the service tracked until suitable mitigations have been deployed through a suitable change-management process?

Question: Vulnerability mitigation timescales
Hint: Do you make timescales for implementing mitigations to vulnerabilities available to buyers?

Question: Protective monitoring
Hint: Do you conduct protective monitoring and analysis to identify suspicious activity?

Question: Incident management processes
Hint: Do you have incident management processes in place and are they enacted in response to security incidents?

Question: Consumer reporting of security incidents
Hint: Do you have a defined process and contact route for reporting security incidents by consumers and external entities?

Question: Security incident definition published
Hint: Do you publish to consumers a definition of a security incident, along with the triggers and timescales for sharing such incidents with service consumers?

Question: Format of security incident notifications published
Hint: Do you publish the content and format of security incident notifications?

Question: Maxiumum timescale for incident investigation
Hint: What are your maximum timescales by which an incident will be investigated?

Question: Personnel security checks
Hint: What kind of personnel security do you apply to staff who have access to the service? Choose all that apply.
Answer 4: Background checks in accordance with BS7858:2012

Question: Secure development
Hint: Are new and evolving threats regularly reviewed and are development tasks initiated to improve and reinforce the security of the service in line with these changing threats?

Question: Secure design, coding, testing and deployment
Hint: Is software development carried out in line with industry good practice regarding secure design, coding, testing and deployment?

Question: Software configuration management
Hint: Are software configuration management processes in place to ensure the integrity of the solution through development, testing and deployment?

Question: Visibility of data shared with third-party suppliers
Hint: Do you inform consumers how much of their information is shared with, or accessible by, third-party suppliers and their supply chains?

Question: Third-party supplier security requirements
Hint: Do your procurement processes ensure that relevant security requirements, such as the Cloud Security Principles, placed on third-party suppliers and delivery partners are explicitly documented?

Question: Third-party supplier risk assessment
Hint: Are the risks to your service from third-party suppliers and delivery partners regularly assessed and appropriate security controls implemented?

Question: Third-party supplier compliance monitoring
Hint: Do you monitor how your suppliers comply with security requirements and initiate remedial action where necessary?

Question: Hardware and software verification
Hint: Do you have the necessary information and processes to verify that hardware and software used in the service is genuine and has not been obviously tampered with?

Question: User authentication and access management
Hint: Can only authorised individuals from the consumer organisation authenticate and access management interfaces for the service?

Question: User access control through support channels
Hint: Can only authorised individuals from the consumer organisation perform actions affecting the consumer’s service through support channels?

Page title: Separation and access control within management interfaces
Question: User access control within management interfaces
Hint: Can consumers manage only their own service, and not access, modify or otherwise affect the service of other consumers via management tools and interfaces?

Page title: Separation and access control within management interfaces
Question: Supports 'principle of least privilege'
Hint: Does your service support consumers in implementing the ‘principle of least privilege’ by providing the ability to constrain permissions given to consumer administrators?

Page title: Separation and access control within management interfaces
Question: Visibility of the networks to which management interfaces are exposed
Hint: Do you inform consumers which networks, management interfaces are exposed to and what functionality is available via those interfaces?

Question: Identity and authentication controls
Hint: What kind of identity and authentication controls do you use to provide an appropriate level of confidence that a user has authorisation to access a specific interface? Choose all that apply.
Answer 4: Limited access over dedicated link, enterprise or community network

Question: Onboarding guidance provided
Hint: Do you provide onboarding guidance, covering safe and secure connection?

Question: Interconnection method provided
Hint: What method of interconnection do you provide? Choose all that apply.

Question: Data access control provided
Hint: Do you provide access control of the data to the service for consumers?

Question: Authentication and authorisation provided
Hint: Do you provide authentication and authorisation to the service for all functions?

Question: Service management model
Hint: Choose 1.
Answer 1: Dedicated devices on a segregated network
Answer 2: Dedicated devices for community service management
Answer 3: Dedicated devices for multiple community service management

Question: Audit information provided
Hint: Do you provide audit information to consumers? Choose 1.

Page title: Secure use of the service by the customer
Question: Device access method
Hint: Which end device is the cloud service accessible from?

Page title: Secure use of the service by the customer
Question: Onboarding guidance
Hint: Do you provide onboarding guidance, including impacts on the consumer’s security?

Page title: Secure use of the service by the customer
Question: Training
Hint: Do you provide user or administrator training on the use of the service and its security?
